results.title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Gary Hannam, John Maynard, New Zealand Film Commission and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: The navigator is remarkable because of its absorbing story that links medieval fears and fortunes to our times, while confirming director Vincent Ward as an original talent. It is Cumbria 1348, the year of the Black Death. A young visionary tells his fellow miners that their community may survive the plague if they place a spire on a distant cathedral before dawn. So, from their grim, snowbound Lake District, they dig down an old mine-shaft to the other side of the world, emerging in an Eastman-coloured present day Auckland, New Zealand. Cast includes Bruce Lyons, Chris Haywood and Hamish McFarlane.

results.title: The Natural
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Delphi II and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bernard Malamud, “The Natural” is one of those heroic, feel good, fairy tale films that captures the human spirit. It is a tale of boyhood dreams, of a certain defiance to turn the dream into reality and become a legend and a superhero in that passionate game of American games, baseball, and of a chance encounter with a mysterious woman that will eventually and catastrophically shatter those very dreams. Robert Redford plays the quiet and unassuming middle-aged Roy Hobbs who at the age of 14 hand-carved his own baseball bat from a tree struck down by lightning on the farm where he lived. It was Roy’s dream to play baseball in the major league and it would be his “wonder boy” bat many years later that would take him to stardom and the major league team, the New York Knights. But like all fairy tales, where good and evil battle it out, Hobbs has his own demons to deal with in the form of knockers, corruption and those who would wish to see him, and the New York Knights, fail. The story climaxes to a tense and spectacular final sequence as our hero takes the bat in a nail-biting challenge to win the pennant for his Knights. This is not a film to be taken too seriously and there are many holes in the plot, but it features a wonderful cast including Glenn Close, Kim Basinger, Robert Duvall, Barbara Hershey, Richard Farnsworth and an uncredited appearance by Darren McGavin.

results.title: The Name of the Rose
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Thomas Schuhly, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Neue Constantin Filmproduktion, Films Ariane and Cristaldifilm
results.brief_description: Sean Connery plays a Brother who is sent to investigate the mysterious deaths of two of the monks at a monastery. He discovers a secret library containing rare books considered lost to the world and dangerous to the Catholic faith. He must find a connection between the deaths and the books before a Catholic Inquisitor (played by F. Murray Abraham) burns innocent people at the stake. Secret passages, forbidden sexual adventures, labyrinths and arsenic are drawn together to create this tale of suspense and intrigue. Based on the novel by Umberto Eco.

results.title: The Mysterians
results.creator_credit: Ishiro Honda, Tomoyuki Tanaka, Peter Riethof, Carlos Montalban and RKO Teleradio Pictures
results.brief_description: Homeless aliens from a ruined planet decide to make Earth their new home in this Japanese horror outing. Soon after the mysterious brainiacs, who arrive in giant flying saucers accompanied by an enormous death-ray spewing robotic bird, establish themselves in a special dome, they demand that the Earth men bring them lots of pretty women so they can start replenishing their depleted population. Special effects by Eiji Tsuburaya.

results.title: The Millionairess
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith, Pierre Rouve and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren plays spoilt millionairess, Epifania Parerga, who having inherited her father’s fortune, is unhappily married and suicidal. When she meets the mild mannered Indian doctor, Ahmed el Kabir, (Peter Sellers in typical disguise), she pursues him with fervour. But despite Epifania’s schemes to attract Ahmed, he is impervious to her allure. Ahmed, who is devoted to running his clinic for the poor, challenges Epifania to live for three months without wealth in order to prove their suitability. He in turn accepts her challenge to turn 500 pounds into 15,000 in three months. Based on the play by Bernard Shaw, the screenplay was significantly updated to accommodate Loren’s physical charms and Sellers’ particular brand of comedy. The results are a mixed bag, with the chemistry between the two leads barely flaring, despite their mutual talents. Running gags revolve around every man falling for Loren, except the one she wants and Loren’s elaborate seduction of the doctor.

results.title: The Mask of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, David Fister, Doug Claybourne and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: From the director of “Goldeneye” comes this swashbuckling action-packed blockbuster starring Anthony Hopkins, Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta Jones. Zorro -legendary name conjures up images of masks, sword fights and one man’s fight for justice. Or is it just one man? Set in California when it’s still controlled from Spain by the Mexican authorities, one man (Anthony Hopkins) fights against injustice for the ordinary man in the only way he can - as a masked phantom. What happens when his world is turned upside down? Does the legend continue and how is this possible? These questions and others are answered as the story unfolds.

results.title: The Man from Laramie
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, William Goetz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Anthony Mann’s classic western tells the story of Will Lockhart (James Stewart) and his search for revenge for the death of his youngest brother. He leaves Laramie in search of the men who sold automatic rifles to the Apache tribe which killed his brother. He arrives in Coronado and is soon embroilled in a bitter battle with the Waggoman family who own most of the land and cattle in the township. Full of great characters and twists in plot, “The Man From Laramie” is an enthralling film with characters who defy simplistic moralistic platitutes.

results.title: The Madness of King George
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Nicholas Hytner, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans and Close Call Film Production
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Alan Bennett, “The Madness of King George” stars Nigel Hawthorne as the ailing King and Helen Mirren as his wife Queen Charlotte. King George the Third, after he lost the American colonies in the War of Independence, succumbed to intermittent bouts of madness where his usual ordered and calm persona underwent a violent and obscene transformation. The Prince of Wales becomes a willing pawn in the plot to commit the King, and establish the Regency. This is a finely acted and sumptuous production of Bennett’s play. Ian Holm plays the Doctor called in to cure the King’s madness using methods which from a modern vantage were brutal and inhumane.

results.title: The Long Good Friday
results.creator_credit: John Mackenzie, Barry Hanson, Calendar and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: In the savage and deadly world of gangland kings, the man at the top is the ruler, only for as long as he controls everything in his territory. For that man, the rewards are infinite - but so are the dangers. Harold Shand, played by Bob Hoskins, London racketeer, is at the peak of his powers. He is on the verge of a major deal with some Americans, to finance the total redevelopment of the London docklands into an enormous leisure complex. But on one long, never-ending day of terror, Good Friday, he is to see his empire crack and crumble. Co-starring Helen Mirren.
